issues.title: Android mapsforge marker displaced
issues.body:
I was having problems with my application because I saw that the markers were displaced as I zoomed in and out, so I decided to install the mapsforge examples.

When I tested them on my Android 9, I discovered that the problem was still there. In the screenshots you can see how the coordinates shown are different as I zoom.

In the screenshots you can see how the position of the marker changes and the coordinates returned by the example are different from the original protected LatLong latLong1 = new LatLong(52.5, 13.4);

This doesn't happen to me in Android version 6 and earlier.

issues.title: Too restrictive max aspect ratio in frame buffer controller
issues.body: For devices with a screen aspect ratio > 2 (e.g. Huawei P30) the max aspect ratio of 2 in frame buffer controller is too restrictive. This leads to wrong results when calculating frame buffer dimensions with Parameters.SQUARE_FRAME_BUFFER set to true.

issues.title: Possible NullpointerException in ClusterManager.getCurBounds
issues.body:
I stumpled upon a NullpointerException in the Android samples ClusterManager, like reported here:
https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/mapsforge-dev/kk2PRQbwSWw

Happening here: https://github.com/mapsforge/mapsforge/blob/51a3350d21812cda25cebcbac9cb5dcf4e79d0f5/mapsforge-samples-android/src/main/java/org/mapsforge/samples/android/cluster/ClusterManager.java#L293

Looks like it's caused when the BoundingBox is not in the current viewport.

I've a small patch to handle possible null here. I'll send a PR with it.

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
fix #1069 NPE in ClusterManager.getCurBounds()

The local variables nw_ and se_ might be null, if the BoundingBox is not in the current viewport.
This patch adds a null check.

issues.body:
here is the trace

```
DALVIK THREADS (71):
"main" prio=5 tid=1 Waiting
  | group="main" sCount=1 dsCount=0 obj=0x740fd000 self=0xb8c776d0
  | sysTid=18402 nice=-4 cgrp=apps sched=0/0 handle=0xb6fefbec
  | state=S schedstat=( 0 0 0 ) utm=1294 stm=174 core=0 HZ=100

  at org.mapsforge.map.view.FrameBufferBitmap$Lock.waitDisabled(FrameBufferBitmap.java:67)
  - locked <0x2ef35f24> (a org.mapsforge.map.view.FrameBufferBitmap$Lock)
  at org.mapsforge.map.view.FrameBufferBitmap.destroy(FrameBufferBitmap.java:101)
  - locked <0x2ef35f24> (a org.mapsforge.map.view.FrameBufferBitmap$Lock)

  - locked <@addr=0x13d3a4c0> (a org.mapsforge.map.view.FrameBufferHA2)
```

Please find attached the modified sample ItemDetailFragment that shows the issue
[ItemDetailFragment.zip](https://github.com/mapsforge/mapsforge/files/1971940/ItemDetailFragment.zip)

it seems that you cannot create a mapview and then destroy it before it is rendered.

In my app I add a map fragment after a database query and the user can exit the activity and so destroy the fragment (that triggers mapView.destroyAll) after the map is created and before it is rendered.

I think that this deadlock can happen in any app even if is not so easy to trigger

issues.title: NPE in TouchGestureHandler
issues.body:
Hello. I found an error in TouchGestureHandler in automatic Google logs. It happens approx 2 times a day in a 10000 users app.

`java.lang.NullPointerException: 
  at org.mapsforge.map.android.input.TouchGestureHandler.onSingleTapConfirmed (TouchGestureHandler.java:232)
  at android.view.GestureDetector$GestureHandler.handleMessage (GestureDetector.java:312)
  at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage (Handler.java:102)
  at android.os.Looper.loop (Looper.java:158)
  at android.app.ActivityThread.main (ActivityThread.java:7224)
  at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke (Native Method)
  at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run (ZygoteInit.java:1230)
  at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main (ZygoteInit.java:1120)`

In my opinion a touch event can move through the event queue after the fragment with map is changed and MapView's destroy method called (which nulls layerManager)

Could you please change the 231 line in TouchGestureHandler from
`if (tapLatLong != null) {`
to
`if (tapLatLong != null && this.mapView.getLayerManager() != null) {`

issues.title: FixedPixelCircle implementation is inconsistent
issues.body:
FixedPixelCircle does density adaption for the raw pixel radius inside getRadiusInPixels(). The radius returned by this function is used for drawing. In contrast, the contains() method uses the raw non density adapted radius. As a result, the contains() method checks if some point is contained in a circle whose radius differs from the circle which is actually drawn.

As a solution I would suggest to remove density adaption from getRadiusInPixels() and just return the raw pixel radius from this function.

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Samples: improve overlays example #724, #944
FixedPixelCircle: improve contains calculation #944
FixedPixelCircle: add scale radius option #944

issues.title: POI: only one category possible per POI
issues.body:
There are several POIs in OSM which have not just one defining tag, but two or more.
E.g. http://www.openstreetmap.org/way/91920694#map=19/47.64615/11.93511 has amenity=restaurant and tourism=alpine_hut

Depending on the source of the POIs (mapsforge or OAM), it is only contained in either one or the other category if I select the category in Cruiser or OruxMaps. So not every amenity=restaurant or tourism=alpine_hut is listed, which would be the expected behaviour. E.g. in bayern.poi from OAM, I only get a few alpine_hut (those who don't have amenity=restaurant), the majority isn't shown, probably because all are categorized in amenity=restaurant.

Only if I use the free text search with alpine_hut or restaurant, I get the expected result.

commitsDetails.commitMessage: POI: multiple POI categories, fixes #940

issues.title: Fling on "Map Rotation" sample goes to wrong direction
issues.body:
When you fling the map on the "Map Rotation" sample with map rotated, the fling direction is not rotated, so it moves to wrong direction.
The problem is that rotateTouchEvent in RotateView only rotates the last position, not historical positions. 
Historical positions can't be modified on MotionEvent's, so I thing the only possible solution without refactoring a lot of code is to get the rotated event with: 
`MotionEvent rotatedEvent = MotionEvent.obtainNoHistory(ev);`
At least when `mapOrientation != 0`

commitsDetails.commitMessage: RotateView: fix rotate touch event #910

issues.title: fix memory handling to enable usage of multiple maps at the same time
issues.body:
This issue comes from #789 

The memory handling of mapsforge maps has to be fixed for use cases where two or more maps are used independently. For example:
1. activity A contains a map view
2. activity B opens activity B
3. activity B contains a map view
4. activity B is closed
5. activity A is shown again

In this app design 2 map views exists at the same time. This works already. There might be issues when both maps show different offline maps (for example A shows map file X, B shows map file Z) but this can be handled by different map caches. 
The issue we found comes from calling 
`MapView.destroyAll().` 
This is supposed to cleanup the used memory and space of the map view. Since it calls 
`AndroidGraphicFactory.clearResourceMemoryCache();` 
all allocated bitmaps of all active map views is cleared. clearResourceMemoryCache() is a static method that accesses a static 
`Map<Integer, Pair<Bitmap, Integer>> RESOURCE_BITMAPS`
that is used by all map view instances at the same time. So it is not possible to clear only the memory of a single map view. 

The next issue described in #789 is that the recycle calls of bitmaps causes an illegal memory access in the still active map views when scrolling and zooming. It causes a potential crash when destroyAll is called during the life time of a map view. Interestingly there is no crash when you close a map and start a new map. Unfortunateley this behaviour has some impact on the overall design of an app since there is no easy way to use two or more maps in different opened activities or fragments.

Please enable the usage of multiple map views at the same time.

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Clear resource memory cache outside MapView destroy calls #790

issues.title: resizing maps view breaks displayed map (with HA)
issues.body:
mapsforge version: 0.6.0-rc1
Android target Version: 15
Android test devices: Samsung S2 (4.1.2) Samsung Galaxy XCover 2 (4.1.2) Samsung S3 (4.3)

_Setup_
We use a mapsforge offline map at the top of an activity. We put a button on top of the map to resize the whole map for a full screen view of the map. The button changes the layout weight of the view to increase and decrease the size of the view.

Here is a sample of the layout XML of the activity:

``` xml
<LinearLayout
        android:layout_width="match_parent"
        android:layout_height="match_parent"
        android:paddingLeft="@dimen/activity_horizontal_margin"
        android:paddingRight="@dimen/activity_horizontal_margin"
        android:paddingBottom="40dp"
        android:background="#f8f8f8"
        android:orientation="vertical">
        <RelativeLayout
            android:id="@+id/map_part"
            android:orientation="vertical"
            android:layout_width="match_parent"
            android:layout_height="0dp"
            android:layout_weight="0.4">
            <FrameLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
                android:id="@+id/map_container"
                android:layout_width="match_parent"
                android:layout_height="match_parent"
                android:layout_marginTop="5dp">
            </FrameLayout>
            <ImageButton
                android:layout_width="wrap_content"
                android:layout_height="wrap_content"
                android:id="@+id/btnMapSize"
                android:layout_marginRight="6dp"
                android:layout_marginTop="6dp"
                android:clickable="true"
                android:alpha="0.8"
                android:src="@drawable/map_fullscreen"
                android:theme="@android:style/Theme.Light"
                android:layout_alignParentBottom="true"
                android:layout_alignParentRight="true"
                android:layout_alignParentEnd="true"/>
        </RelativeLayout>
        <ListView
            android:layout_width="wrap_content"
            android:layout_height="0dp"
            android:id="@+id/entryListView"
            android:layout_weight="0.6"
            android:clickable="true" />

    </LinearLayout>
```

The activity adds a click listener on the image button that will find the _map_part_ layout and increase the layout weight of it. The frame layout shows a simple layout containing the mapsforge map:

``` xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<RelativeLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
    android:id="@+id/mainView"
    android:layout_width="fill_parent"
    android:layout_height="fill_parent" >

    <org.mapsforge.map.android.view.MapView
        android:id="@+id/forgeMap"
        android:layout_width="fill_parent"
        android:layout_height="fill_parent"
        android:clickable="true"/>

    <ImageButton
        android:layout_width="wrap_content"
        android:layout_height="wrap_content"
        android:id="@+id/mapCompas"
        android:layout_marginRight="6dp"
        android:layout_marginTop="6dp"
        android:clickable="true"
        android:alpha="0.8"
        android:src="@drawable/map_compas"
        android:theme="@android:style/Theme.Light"
        android:layout_alignParentTop="true"
        android:layout_alignParentRight="true"
        android:layout_alignParentEnd="true"/>

</RelativeLayout>
```

The code of the fragment does not handle sizing of the map. Sizing and resizing is all done by default over the XML layout. We use the OSMARENDER theme for display.

_Issue_
When changing the size of the map over the button after the first or second resize the display of the loaded map changes and the map is displayed faulty. The map look like it is stretched and pushed to the rigth upper side. The map is still functioning and the map scale is not affected by this error. All drawn elements like markers, position marker and the map itself are affected.

I append a before and after image show the effect. 
![before](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16191729/11629792/7f18c772-9cfa-11e5-8158-3fb0f2b9e2d7.png)
![after](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16191729/11629794/82fad024-9cfa-11e5-938c-8eb2b348296b.png)

The effect does not disappear when we try to resize it again and again. It does not disappear when we try to change the display position or zoom level. A forced repaint does not help. 

The error is seen on the S2 and XCover 2 devices we use for testing. We can not see this ill effect on the S3. Maybe it is a concurency issue unlikely to happen on faster devices. On the S2 and XCover the error is seen all the time after 1 or 2 attempts to resize the map.

We tried to debug into the matter but all we found is that pivot is not the cause of the problem.

issues.title: Marker.draw NPE at cleanup
issues.body:
Playing with many markers on the map, occasionally at Android app exit (i.e. resources cleanup), I have seen NPE inside `Marker.draw` method, specifically for its `bitmap`.

Though we check `bitmap` state at `draw` start, possible race conditions with `Marker.onDestroy` manage to nullify it prior `draw` exit.

It's worth investigating also if `Bitmap`'s enclosing `android.graphics.Bitmap` is null or recycled at `draw` start. Probably we need to place checks for that too.

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Mapsforge Bitmap: include a check for internal bitmap condition
Marker: check internal bitmap at draw #659

issues.title: Rendering problem with DY on lines
issues.body:
In `RendererUtils` at polyline calculation with distance `dy` parallel to given coordinates, we may have `Double.NaN` values at `u[k]` [here](https://github.com/mapsforge/mapsforge/blob/master/mapsforge-map/src/main/java/org/mapsforge/map/layer/renderer/RendererUtils.java#L31-L36).
The `c` and `s` can come `0` because of same location points at `p[]` subtraction.

The related conversation (along with screenshots) is [here](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/mapsforge-dev/2wqwfCl3P80) in the forum.

issues.title: Missing islands / coastline
issues.body:
Playing with latest maps and Osmarender, I see we still have the issue with islands under water and missing coastline.

The problem arises from `natural=coastline` declaration [here](https://github.com/mapsforge/mapsforge/blob/master/mapsforge-map/src/main/resources/osmarender/osmarender.xml#L198-L205), which fills the islands on top of the `nosea` fill.

How about removing the aforementioned block or use as fill the `nosea` color?
Since it causes issues and now the land / sea elements are defined at different [location](https://github.com/mapsforge/mapsforge/blob/master/mapsforge-map/src/main/resources/osmarender/osmarender.xml#L5-L11) in the theme.

![islands](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3484020/7784246/876496f6-0167-11e5-8365-02ae5734fe42.png)

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Render themes: remove coastline rules, fix #615

issues.title: relation type=multipolygon reverses direction of oneway=yes
issues.body:
When a one-way street is added into a multipolygon relation, it is rendered as going the opposite way.
Steps to reproduce:
1. have multiple ways forming a closed loop, some of them one-way (oneway=yes)
2. make a relation type=multipolygon
3. add the ways to relation as type=outer
4. render and display map:
   $ osmosis --read-xml file=./praha-centrum-bugOnewayRelationOnly.osm --mw file=./praha-centrum.map && java -jar ~/prog/osm/Atlas-Beta-1.2.13/Atlas-Beta.jar ./praha-centrum.map
   (
   INFO: Osmosis Version 0.43.1-39-gcd86c44-SNAPSHOT
   May 18, 2015 12:16:28 AM org.openstreetmap.osmosis.core.Osmosis run
   INFO: Preparing pipeline.
   May 18, 2015 12:16:28 AM org.mapsforge.map.writer.osmosis.MapFileWriterTask <init>
   INFO: mapfile-writer version: mapsforge-map-writer-0.5.1
   )

Expected result: one-way arrows displayed along the ways, in the ways' direction (similarly as in bitmap renderings, e.g. Mapnik - note the red route: IRL arrives from east, continues south)
![mapnik_177633](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/917239/7672472/7af167a4-fcf4-11e4-9b79-827ed39687c5.png)

Actual result: one-way arrows displayed _in opposite direction_ than mapped - note that only the ways in relation are affected (note that the southern part of the red route is now incorrectly shown as leading _to_ the intersection, not _away_ from it)
![reversed1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/917239/7672475/8461dc06-fcf4-11e4-984f-869724c5e005.png)

Here's a minimal case manifesting the symptoms: http://i.piskvor.org/osm/mapsforge/praha-centrum-bugOnewayRelationOnly.osm , here's the same relation in OSM: http://www.openstreetmap.org/relation/2052491

Removing the way from relation restores expected behavior (one-way arrows point in the correct direction), but that's very much mapping for a renderer, and cripples the relation's data.

This issue appears both in the mapsforge Java viewer and in Android (Locus); I have also downloaded a map generated by someone else (from OSM via osmosis, probably similarly to me), and it exhibits the same symptoms: http://osm.paws.cz/czech_republic_ee.map

issues.title: MapViewPosition.animateTo wobbling
issues.body: Trying consecutive calls of `MapViewPosition.animateTo`, e.g. quick follow my location via a mock provider or outside in a fast vehicle, we see that the map animation is performed around the actual position, back and forth alternatively.

commitsDetails.commitMessage: MapViewPosition: improve animateTo formula, fix consecutive wobbling #607

issues.title: Strange bbox Map Writer Bug
issues.body:
I've bound a strange bug in the map writer. It sometimes has issues when there is too much precision in the bbox passed in to it. I'm not sure if the bug is in the map writer or osmosis, but this is the result:
![image1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1422186/7597229/f9682c64-f8a6-11e4-9be8-343c13eb8a93.jpg)
The left map was created with:

osmosis --rx 3-0-2-mf.osm --mw file=3-0-2.nmap bbox=40.97990,-180.0,66.51326,-135.0

and the right one with

osmosis --rx 3-0-2-mf.osm --mw file=3-0-2.map bbox=40.9798980696201270,-180.0000000000000000,66.51326
04431118610,-135.0000000000000000

As you can see, the only difference is the number of significant digits in the bbox. I debugged MapFileWriterTask.java, and found that the bbox was being parsed correctly in both cases.

issues.title: National parks rendered incorrectly
issues.body:
I suspect that this bug is in the map writer, but it could also be caused by the rendering code. Large polygons, such as national parks are rendered as large transparent areas with some green on the edges. Sometimes, the polygon fragments are inverted - they are filled in when they should be cut out instead. 
![mapsforgebug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1422186/6488366/de1413c4-c24b-11e4-8e72-bd843582a65e.jpg)
See the attached JPG. The left pane is rendered with mapsforge, and the right pane is a screen grab from openstreetmaps.org.

issues.title: Introduce map zoom factor for devices with xhdpi displays
issues.body:
_From [christia...@gmx.at](https://code.google.com/u/102625142710619456857/) on November 10, 2014 07:41:00_

Relates to:
mapsforge 0.3 used in c:geo to display pre-rendered map tiles

Problem:
Some Android devices have a very high pixel density. For example my Xperia Z has 443ppi.
Mapnik-rendered maps have a constant pixel height for all labels. For example a street name is ~6pixels in height.
As a result, labels are often so small they are not readable any more. For example a street name on my Xperia Z is smaller than 0.4mm

Proposal:
Introduce a customizable zoom factor. All map tiles are magnified by that factor. (A similar feature can be tried out in Locus under Map Options/Advanced Settings)

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=543_

Its need to add <additionalparam>-Xdoclint:none</additionalparam> in maven-javadoc-plugin to build maven project with java 8. http://stackoverflow.com/questions/15886209/maven-is-not-working-in-java-8-when-javadoc-tags-are-incomplete <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-javadoc-plugin</artifactId>
                <executions>
                    <execution>
                        <id>attach-javadoc</id>
                        <phase>package</phase>
                        <goals>
                            <goal>jar</goal>
                        </goals>
                        <configuration>

What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Zoom a map.
2. Drag it to some new position quickly (before the first frame for the new zoom level will be finished). What is the expected output? What do you see instead? It takes place in 5.0.0_rc1 both under PC (Windows 7 x64) and Android. Please provide any additional information below. It looks like in FrameBufferController.adjustFrameBufferMatrix(...) should be 

long mapSize = MercatorProjection.getMapSize(mapViewPosition.zoomLevel, model.displayModel.getTileSize());

instead of 

long mapSize = MercatorProjection.getMapSize(mapPositionFrameBuffer.zoomLevel, model.displayModel.getTileSize());

issues.title: ConcurrentModificationException may occur when the app exits
issues.body:
_From [yst...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/106774087836489148242/) on October 04, 2014 02:55:19_

What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Press the Back button to exit the app. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expect to exit normally, but ConcurrentModificationException may occur sometimes. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? mapsforge revision 1fe577013d6c . Please provide any additional information below. Stack trace:
    java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to destroy activity {<...MyActivity>}: java.util.ConcurrentModificationException
            at android.app.ActivityThread.performDestroyActivity(ActivityThread.java:3624)
            at android.app.ActivityThread.handleDestroyActivity(ActivityThread.java:3642)
            at android.app.ActivityThread.access$1200(ActivityThread.java:156)
            at android.app.ActivityThread$H.handleMessage(ActivityThread.java:1393)
            at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:99)
            at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:153)
            at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5297)
            at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method)
            at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:511)
            at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:833)
            at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:600)
            at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method)
     Caused by: java.util.ConcurrentModificationException
            at java.util.LinkedHashMap$LinkedHashIterator.nextEntry(LinkedHashMap.java:350)
            at java.util.LinkedHashMap$ValueIterator.next(LinkedHashMap.java:374)
            at org.mapsforge.map.layer.cache.InMemoryTileCache.destroy(InMemoryTileCache.java:52)
            at org.mapsforge.map.layer.cache.TwoLevelTileCache.destroy(TwoLevelTileCache.java:48)
            at <...MyActivity>.onDestroy(<...MyActivity>.java:174)
            at android.app.Activity.performDestroy(Activity.java:5291)
            at android.app.Instrumentation.callActivityOnDestroy(Instrumentation.java:1112)
            at android.app.ActivityThread.performDestroyActivity(ActivityThread.java:3611)
            at android.app.ActivityThread.handleDestroyActivity(ActivityThread.java:3642)
            at android.app.ActivityThread.access$1200(ActivityThread.java:156)
            at android.app.ActivityThread$H.handleMessage(ActivityThread.java:1393)
            at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:99)
            at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:153)
            at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5297)
            at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method)
            at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:511)
            at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:833)
            at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:600)
            at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method)

One possible cause may be that the method InMemoryTileCache.setWorkingSet() is not synchronized such that setWorkingSet() may modify lruCache when destroy() is iterating lruCache.

After I add the synchronized keyword, it seems that the exception does not occur.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=532_

issues.body:
_From [yst...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/106774087836489148242/) on September 23, 2014 11:57:00_

What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. setOnTouchListener on MapView to handle some custom gestures involving two fingers.
2. Use more than two fingers. Events for the 3rd/4th/... fingers will be passed to mapsforge. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expect that the custom gesture works properly without issue, but NPE may occur sometimes. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Latest master revision - 25b5f2d0d6d8. Please provide any additional information below. The NPE occurs as an invalid pointerIndex is passed to motionEvent.getX() in TouchEventHandler.
Attached a version which will check whether the pointerIndex is valid or not first.

issues.title: Train stations and roundabouts are dropped by mapsforge-map-writer
issues.body:
_From [yst...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/106774087836489148242/) on September 23, 2014 10:33:07_

What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Obtain an OSM with train stations (building=train_station, railway=station) or roundabouts (junction=roundabout, highway=*).
2. Convert the OSM to MAP using mapsforge-map-writer. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? The train stations and roundabouts should be in the output MAP file, but they are dropped by the writer. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Latest master revision - 25b5f2d0d6d8, on Linux. Please provide any additional information below. The problem should be due to the OSMUtils.isArea(way) checking in TDWay.java. Removing the checking can solve the issue.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=526_

The current map is broken. Many major roads in Bucharest (capital city) are simply not shown at most high zoom levels, while some but not all small roads are visible.

issues.title: Loading of Resources broken in InternalRenderTheme
issues.body:
_From [trohwe...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/115982957535135773156/) on June 04, 2014 13:39:04_

The line 

return Thread.currentThread().getClass().getResourceAsStream(this.absolutePath + this.file);

in org/mapsforge/map/rendertheme/InternalRenderTheme

does not make much sense and does not work as expected depending on
the classloader setup. Thread.currentThread().getClass() gives you
most likely just Thread.class! But you want your resources resolved with respect to
the classloader of some application class, not the classloader of some arbitrary system class. I suggest replacing this by

getClass().getResourceAsStream(this.absolutePath + this.file);

i.e. resolving the resources with respect to InternalRenderTheme.class
This works for example when putting the resources together with the rendertheme classes as library file in android. The original code does not work.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=503_

issues.title: Document Java 7 requirement
issues.body:
_From [mich...@vonglasow.com](https://code.google.com/u/111651497437367747710/) on May 11, 2014 16:03:57_

What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Using Eclipse and ADT version 17, try to build a project using Mapsforge 0.4.0.
2. Wonder why you keep getting this NoClassDefFoundError exception all the time, despite having followed all the steps. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expected: A project that builds cleanly and runs without any errors.
Instead: Project builds but crashes with the above exception at the first call to the Mapsforge library. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? 0.4.0 on Ubuntu 12.04 32-bit, Eclipse Juno, Java 6, ADT version 17. Please provide any additional information below. After posting on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/23587939/noclassdeffounderror-with-mapsforge-0-4-0-and-eclipse , I examined the dexed libs and found out the Mapsforge libs contained no classes. Viewing the classes from the original Mapsforge jars I noticed they are Java 7, which my version of ADT did not support.

Please document in the How-to wiki articles that recent builds of Mapsforge are Java 7, which in turn requires upgrading the toolchain to version 19 or higher. Feel free to use my Stackoverflow post (link above) as a starting point.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=497_

issues.title: Scale dash strokes
issues.body:
_From [tartami...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/115560783500310858875/) on December 26, 2013 16:25:43_

I think it is incoherent to scale stroke-width according to zoom-level and leave dash-stroke untouched. Especially with round linecaps, when zooming in the actual dash distance decreases to the point that dashes touch each other(because of the growing linecap radius).
There should be an option to scale both (similar to scale-radius for circles).

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=471_

issues.title: Add ‘stroke-linejoin’ property for lines
issues.body:
_From [tartami...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/115560783500310858875/) on December 26, 2013 16:12:14_

Currently corners are rendered as miter joins. This is usually not an issue for roads where curves have a lot of points, but can look very bad for paths that usually aren't that detailed. Adding a ‘stroke-linejoin’ property for lines would allow a much nicer rendering.

For reference: http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/painting.html#StrokeProperties

issues.title: Rewrite: AWT semi-transparent overlays
issues.body:
_From [devemu...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/109528871084914010993/) on December 01, 2013 17:25:54_

Hi,

Playing with SwingMapViewer, I see that I cannot have a semi-transparent overlay, e.g. circle overlay like the accuracy of my location.

I think the reason is at the setColor method of AwtPaint class.

In it there is:
this.color = new java.awt.Color(color);
where it creates an opaque sRGB color.

It would be better as:
this.color = new java.awt.Color(color, true);
where it creates an sRGB color with the specified combined RGBA value, and we can control the alpha of the color.

Best regards, Emux https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=gr.talent.cruiser

issues.title: Town and village names not shown
issues.body:
_From [boris.ho...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/114952506258624991533/) on August 08, 2013 19:01:06_

I discovered this problem with Oruxmaps 5.5.3, which uses the mapsforge library to render vector maps. Some of the problems reported below can be reproduced with AdvancedMapViewer-0.3.1 on CM 7.2.

If I use http://download.mapsforge.org/maps/europe/germany/sachsen.map or http://www.openandromaps.org/maps/Germany/sachsen.zip , the names of some places are not shown in Oruxmaps.

With the latter map and no stylesheet, the name of the
- town "Bad Schandau" in Saxony, Germany is not shown at zoom levels 10 - 13 and 15, 17.
- village "Waltersdorf" in Saxony, Germany is not shown at zoom levels 14 - 16

I checked at the OSM website, but not in the map itself, that these places are correctly labeled.

If I use my own stylesheet that contains the the attached code, then the name of the
- town "Bad Schandau" in Saxony, Germany is only shown at zoom level 14
- village "Waltersdorf" in Saxony, Germany is not shown at zoom levels 12, 14, 16
- village "Kurort Rathen" in Saxony, Germany is not shown at zoom levels 12, 15 - 17

According to my stylesheet, these places should be shown on all zoom levels >= 12.

**Attachment:** [ss.xml](http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=448)

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=448_

issues.title: What does "renderable=false" exactly mean?
issues.body:
_From [uzemelt...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/101242382915017108584/) on July 31, 2013 10:55:30_

In the XML schema documentation for tag-mapping.xml (see https://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/source/browse/mapsforge-map-writer/src/main/resources/tag-mapping.xsd ), the 'renderable' attribute is documented as follows: 

"The attribute 'renderable' specifies
                        whether the tag is renderable. Omitting the attribute is
                        interpreted as renderable=true."

and, later: 

"Indicates whether the tag is renderable. Omitting
                                the attribute indicates that the tag is renderable."

This is like saying "the name of a person indicates the name of a person". Please document this attribute properly. I don't really understand what it does and when it should be used.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=446_

issues.title: Closed outer ways of multipolygons are reported as invalid and skipped
issues.body:
_From [morav...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/115730355087327916966/) on May 15, 2013 23:04:02_

What steps will reproduce the problem? run osmosis with attached file (it contains just the two problematic multipolygons - ways 38321616 and 38321623): 
osmosis --rx missing.osm --mw file=test.map bbox=47.726460,16.828400,49.618600,22.570510 What is the expected output? What do you see instead? The multipolygons (protected area boundaries) should be included, but they are dropped. Previous comments in project's google group concerning this issue indicated that the ways are not closed and thus not forming the boundary, but as far as I can tell from the data is not true in this case. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? mapsforge-map-writer-0.3.1-SNAPSHOT-jar-with-dependencies.jar

issues.title: Rewrite: rotation will cause NPE
issues.body:
_From [LudwigBr...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/113327232123772191739/) on March 23, 2013 12:11:01_

Rotating the device will cause an NPE in the rewrite branch:

E/AndroidRuntime(19149): java.lang.NullPointerException
E/AndroidRuntime(19149):    at org.mapsforge.map.reader.MapDatabase.readMapData(MapDatabase.java:314)
E/AndroidRuntime(19149):    at org.mapsforge.map.layer.renderer.DatabaseRenderer.executeJob(DatabaseRenderer.java:151)
E/AndroidRuntime(19149):    at org.mapsforge.map.layer.renderer.MapWorker.renderTile(MapWorker.java:63)
E/AndroidRuntime(19149):    at org.mapsforge.map.layer.renderer.MapWorker.doWork(MapWorker.java:45)
E/AndroidRuntime(19149):    at org.mapsforge.map.PausableThread.run(PausableThread.java:140)

What happens is that the mapfile gets closed and reopened with every rotation, and sometimes a worker thread is trying to access the mapfile in the interval between.

This can be reproduced either by just rotating a device a few times (running the Rewrite app) or by using my robotium based test for the rewrite branch https://code.google.com/r/ludwigbrinckmann-mapsforge/source/list?name=rewrite-test : the test that do not involve rotation pass, the ones with rotation fail.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=416_

issues.title: Time difference with Osm conversion with map-writer
issues.body:
_From [carlito...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/103525559061021176074/) on January 28, 2013 12:43:37_

What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Use 2 different OSM files. To extract the regions I've tried, I've used this commands:

osmosis --rb spain.osm.pbf --bb top=41.286 left=-5.29513 bottom=38.0879 right=-0.95136 --wx Castilla-La_Mancha.osm

and

osmosis --rb norway.osm.pbf --bb top=59.0167 left=6.38333 bottom=57.9833 right=8.16667 --wx Vest-Agder.osm

The spain.osm.pbf file and the norway.osm.pbf file, are downloaded from Geofabrik. I've extracted the regions of Castilla La Mancha(Spain) and Vest-Agder(Norway).
1. After that, I wanted to do the conversion between OSM files and the Mapsforge map files. So I used this commands:

osmosis --rx Castilla-La_Mancha.osm --mw file=Castilla-La_Mancha.map bbox=38.0879,-5.29513,41.286,-0.95136

and

osmosis --rx Vest-Agder.osm --mw file=Vest-Agder.map bbox=57.9833,6.38333,59.0167,8.16667 
1. The conversion time was 126687 milliseconds(for the spanish region) and 617612 milliseconds(for the norwegian one).

You could say to me that, "Ok, it's not a huge difference, it's managable", but actually, I don't think so. Because the file sizes are very different. The spanish region, is about 1GB, and the norwegian 109MB. So I guess that there ir a problem with the map-writer or the OSM file. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? I'll expect less time. If I had obtained less time on the norwegian map, it'll be normal, cause od the size. But it happened on the other way. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Osmosis 0.40.1 and map-writer 0.3.0(with dependences)

Thanks for all your work!

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=399_

issues.title: OutOfMemoryError
issues.body:
_From [kel...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/111692820959942452823/) on December 18, 2012 20:03:29_

I have three Overlays, two ArrayItemizedOverlays and one ArrayWayOverlay.

The first ArrayItemizedOverlays are several POIs in the map. The second one is a custom MyLocationOverlay class that extends ItemizedOverlays and only holds one overlay for the user location. The third overlay traces the route between POIs.

When run on my Galaxy Nexus with MapsForge 0.3.0, it works fine but exiting the activity then going back a couple of times crashes because of an OutOfMemory Exception thrown by Overlay.ChangeSize.

I've read other issue posts regarding this problem but the answer seems to be to use only a short number of Overlays, and I'm only using 3.

Should I somehow clear the memory or remove objects before exiting my activity?

Instead I see "OutOfMemoryError: bitmap size exceeds VM budget"" at FrameBuffer and/or OverlayController at the points where they re-create their bitmaps after the size change. issues.title: Checkstyles: remove DoubleCheckedLocking
issues.body:
_From [LudwigBr...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/113327232123772191739/) on November 25, 2012 14:41:08_

Checkstyle 5.6 removes the DoubleCheckedLocking rule, which prevents builds from working when Checkstyle is enabled:

Eclipse errors:
Problems occurred building the selected resources.
Errors running builder 'Checkstyle Builder' on project 'AdvancedMapViewer'.
cannot initialize module TreeWalker - Unable to instantiate DoubleCheckedLocking
cannot initialize module TreeWalker - Unable to instantiate DoubleCheckedLocking
cannot initialize module TreeWalker - Unable to instantiate DoubleCheckedLocking
cannot initialize module TreeWalker - Unable to instantiate DoubleCheckedLocking

Checkstyle recommends removing the rule: http://sourceforge.net/p/checkstyle/bugs/682/ This affects the main checkstyle file, as well as the copies for AMV and Samples.

I will attach a patch once I have checked that this solves the issue.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=377_

issues.title: MyLocation icon redraw during zoom
issues.body:
_From [devemu...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/109528871084914010993/) on November 14, 2012 14:34:26_

Hi,

I use an arrow for my location icon in order to rotate it at the direction of the user, based on Sensor.TYPE_ORIENTATION
In order to refresh the arrow direction I call mapView.getOverlayController().redrawOverlays() in onSensorChanged.

The problem:
When I pinch the map to zoom in/out (without raising the fingers from the screen) and the arrow redraws, its position does not follow the mapview zoom in/out. Because of the frequent redrawOverlays calls, it appears in its original position, ignoring the zoom in/out.

Is there any solution to this?
Is there any way to know when the user tries to zoom in/out in order to not call the redrawOverlays?
I know the mapView.isZoomAnimatorRunning() but it is "true" only when the zoom actually happens, when the user raises its fingers from the screen. During the pinch period, is there any way to know this?

Thanks.

issues.title: MapFileWriter-SNAPSHOT: GC overhead limit exceeded
issues.body:
_From [starous6...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/100862657324016620498/) on October 18, 2012 23:33:16_

What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Start command:
env JAVACMD_OPTIONS="-server -Xmx2500M" ~/bin/osmosis/bin/osmosis --read-pbf file=~/MKGMAP/osm/NOR-OSM-SRTM.osm.pbf --mw file=./NOR-SRTM.map type=hd tag-conf-file=./tag-mapping-srtm.xml

where:
NOR-OSM-SRTM.osm.pbf is Norwegian OSM map merged with map with elevation contour generated from SRTM
tag-mapping-srtm.xml is attached file
1. After lot of hours this command finishes with this error message:
   ...
   java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: GC overhead limit exceeded
   ...
2. If I suppress this type of error by -XX:-UseGCOverheadLimit option, I get another error:
   ...
   INFO: written 70.0% of sub file for zoom interval index 2
   18.10.2012 10:13:55 org.mapsforge.map.writer.MapFileWriter processTile
   WARNING: error in parallel preprocessing of ways
   java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap s
   pace
   ...
   The full log of this latest MapFileWriter run is attached (NOR.log file) What is the expected output? What do you see instead? I expect correct MAP file, but I got only some partial result and some error messages... What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? I am using Osmosis Version 0.40.1-101-g6dd9f48 and SNAPSHOT from SVN (downloaded and compiled at 10/12/2012).
   I am using SVN version because I was probably affected by issue 354 (352) - at least I got the same error messages when I started "official release" MapFileWriter with my version of osmosis.
   All is running on more or less standard Debian Squeeze Linux. Please provide any additional information below. This problem looks to appear only on Norwegian map - I have successfully converted another countries with the same command style and merged OSM-SRM maps, some are bigger than Norwegian, e.g. Germany, Austria.
   But also on these countries I had some small troubles - with previous version of osmosis and "official release" MapFileWriter there was sufficient to allocate 512MB for heap. With newest versions I need to allocate approx. 1024MB even if type=hd option is specified.

**Attachment:** [tag-mapping-srtm.xml NOR.log](http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=362)

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=362_

issues.title: Render-theme with "mtb:scale:uphill" and "mtb:scale" displays wrong tags
issues.body:
_From [frank.hu...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/109115453950959521277/) on September 18, 2012 21:58:02_

What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Create a small xml (osm) file rttesttrack.xml, modify some tracks and add mtb:scale and mtb:scale:uphill tags. Tags should be different (e.g mtb:scale = 1, mtb:scale:uphill=2)
1. Add the following lines after line 386 to the original tag-mapping.xml and save it as mtbtag-mapping.xml:
   
   ```
   <osm-tag key="mtb:scale" value="0" renderable="true" />
   <osm-tag key="mtb:scale" value="1" renderable="true" />
   <osm-tag key="mtb:scale" value="2" renderable="true" />
   <osm-tag key="mtb:scale" value="3" renderable="true" />
   <osm-tag key="mtb:scale" value="4" renderable="true" />
   
   <osm-tag key="mtb:scale:uphill" value="0" renderable="true" />
   <osm-tag key="mtb:scale:uphill" value="1" renderable="true" />
   <osm-tag key="mtb:scale:uphill" value="2" renderable="true" />
   <osm-tag key="mtb:scale:uphill" value="3" renderable="true" />
   <osm-tag key="mtb:scale:uphill" value="4" renderable="true" />
   ```
2. Convert the modified osm file with osmosis/mapwriter: 
   osmosis-0.40.1/bin/osmosis --rx file=rttesttrack.xml --mw file=rttesttrack.map
   bbox=48.48,9.17,48.5,9.19 tag-conf-file=mtbtag-mapping.xml
3. Modify an existing render theme (I took the bluenight-theme from Locus forum), add the lines to show up symbols for MTB (for those interested, I tried to make the same symbols as in openmtbmap.org map for Garmin devices). I will not show all tags, but the idea is: 

<!-- MTB -->

<rule e="way" k="highway" v="track|path">
  <rule e="way" k="mtb:scale" v="0" zoom-min="16">
    <lineSymbol src="file:/symbols/mtbscale0.png"
        align-center="false" repeat="true" />
  </rule>
  <rule e="way" k="mtb:scale" v="1" zoom-min="16">
    <lineSymbol src="file:/symbols/mtbscale1.png"
        align-center="false" repeat="true" />
  </rule>

  <rule e="way" k="mtb:scale:uphill" v="0" zoom-min="16">
    <lineSymbol src="file:/symbols/mtbscaleuphill0.png"
        align-center="false" repeat="true" />
  </rule>
</rule>

(I added the same rules for all scales (0 to 4) with the respective symbol)
1. Opened Locus, used the new map file to show up the map with with the new tags shown as expected What is the expected output? What do you see instead? I do not see the correct tags. It looks like  mtb:scale:uphill value overided the mtb:scale value: A track with mtb:scale set to 0 and mtb:scale:uphill set to 4 shows up with symbols for mtb:scale=4 and mtb:scale:uphill=4

The map shows up (also with other render themes), no errors. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? I do use the current map-writer (0.30), osmosis 0.40.1 and Locus Pro 2.6.1 Please provide any additional information below. So far I did not check the MapViewer.apk. I will check this later and add my findings.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=353_

issues.title: OverlayController crash.
issues.body:
_From [invaderz...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/113903271883227789234/) on August 15, 2012 01:24:08_

I'm using MapView inside a Fragment using the MapFragment patch that you can find in the mapsforge group.

I have 2 fragments on my layout, but the second one is GONE till the user needs it, when that happen, i change the layout programmatically in both Fragments and you get both Fragments on screen. Its working exactly as expected with every Android version previous to Jelly Bean.
Also, i'm not adding any overlay to the screen yet, its just the MapFragment showing the Map.

Its seems its a bug on JellyBean that if you resize a bitman to the same size it previusly had, the bitmap it returns its the same as the not-resize, so, if you call recycle on it, you will recycle both. I don't know the mapsforge code well enough to find it and i have never worked with canvas yet. If you need me to post the code of how i work the layout, so you can reproduce the bug, let me know and i can email you a small project that show this crash.
It seems the I/O app had the same problem and so it happened on Firefox Mobile.

Thanks in advance... I'm using the latest version from the repository.

issues.title: IllegalArgumentException when converting coordinates
issues.body:
_From [uzemelt...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/101242382915017108584/) on July 22, 2012 11:23:10_

A user reported this bug for my Android app using ACRA:

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: invalid longitude: 404.296875
at org.mapsforge.core.model.Coordinates.validateLongitude(Coordinates.java:92)
at org.mapsforge.core.model.GeoPoint.validateCoordinates(GeoPoint.java:69)
at org.mapsforge.core.model.GeoPoint.<init>(GeoPoint.java:104)
at org.mapsforge.core.model.GeoPoint.<init>(GeoPoint.java:94)
at org.mapsforge.android.maps.MapViewProjection.fromPixels(MapViewProjection.java:47)
at org.mapsforge.android.maps.inputhandling.TouchEventHandler.forwardLongPressEvent(TouchEventHandler.java:158)
at org.mapsforge.android.maps.inputhandling.LongPressDetector.run(LongPressDetector.java:72)

This can be reproduced as follows:
1. Zoom out until you reach minimal zoom level
2. Try to long-press at extremal screen positions
3. MercatorProjection.pixelXToLongitude will then return a value outside -180..+180. (I think the same is possible with pixelYToLatitude.)
4. In the trunk, it will then throw an IllegalArgumentException. In v0.3.0, the validator will throw a similar Exception.

Possible solutions:
- allow longitude wrap-around
- check coordinates at long-click event, and do nothing if they are not within the allowed bounds

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=338_

issues.title: Memory leak in MyLocationOverlay
issues.body:
_From [neilboyd](https://code.google.com/u/neilboyd/) on June 03, 2012 20:58:01_

I'm pleased to see that you've implemented MyLocationOverlay in issue 71 , but I see that there's a known memory leak issue in it. Namely that you shouldn't use "this" to register the listener. Instead create a class purely for that purpose.

For more information see https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=15170 and https://code.google.com/p/osmdroid/issues/detail?id=156

How to replicate the problem:

3. Import the sample project to eclipse
4. Copy the hamburg.map to SD
5. Install and run Samples.apk on Android 4.0 Galaxy Nexus.
6. Select "BasicMapViewer", "DualMapViewer", or "OverlayMapViewer" from menu ("DownloadMapViewer" works). What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expected output: a working MapView.
Instead: the app changes activity to MapView, but the app crashes within a couple seconds and no map loads in the view. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? issues.title: Unable to pause activity crash
issues.body:
_From [jos...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/112928901021613045315/) on April 16, 2012 22:01:42_

When starting MapActivity in onCreate function I check for ExternalStorage availability. If it wasn't found - I display AlertDialog to inform user, that he needs an SD card. Unfortunately, after closing dialog, which should finish the activity, I get crash with an error message "java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to pause activity". I've attached full log with my debug messages, to better illustrate the chain of events.
Same code worked correctly on mapsforge v0.2.4.
Quick glance at mapsforge source code reveals the problem - MapActivity onPause() function presumes, that MapView is available, but it should check if it is not null, before accessing the object.
In my case, I haven't inflated MapView from layout, because inflating it without SD card results in Issue 256 .

issues.title: Mapforge renders multipolygons with more than one "outer" way incorrectly
issues.body:
_From [jos...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/112928901021613045315/) on April 11, 2012 13:33:26_

Mapforge renders multipolygons with more than one "outer" way incorrectly.

Example relation: http://www.openstreetmap.org/browse/relation/968968 (outer ways in this relation are in correct order and even follow "old-days" rule - ways go in clockwise direction)

Note that OSM has a hardcoded limit that a way cannot contain more than 2000 nodes, therefore most large forests are marked with more than one outer way.

P.S. Mapnik, osmarender, mkgmap are handling this type of multipolygon correctly, maybe code/routines could be re-used? (mkgmap is a java app)

Tested with latest stable release v0.3.0

**Attachment:** [vilnius-draw-error.png](http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=290)

issues.title: Allow for relative paths in render-theme files
issues.body:
_From [menion.asamm](https://code.google.com/u/menion.asamm/) on March 22, 2012 07:21:36_

In new version 0.3.0 is introduced very nice system for Theming. I implemented it into Locus application together with manually select Theme from predefined directory. Anyway all themes may contain "file:/..." but this path have to be absolute as I look into code!

This do not make much sense for me because when anyway create theme that others will want to use on another devices or another program, it will have to rewrite all absolute paths to difference values. 

I created support for "fileR:/..." with ability to define ROOT directory for relative paths and it works quite well and there's no worry about directory where is theme placed

So is there something I miss or these "relative paths" aren't possible in Theme system so it's always need to rewrite paths to correct values?

_From [dientran...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/113826169496329340760/) on February 27, 2012 11:43:49_

My english is bad. :) I briefly described How to Build the AdvancedMapViewer project to reduce the time for you (I was quite time consuming)
In ubuntu 10.04 (long - term version)
1.Installing Subclipse
NOTE: On Ubuntu 9.10+ you may need to install the eclipse-pde package before installing Subclipse.
$ sudo apt-get install eclipse-pde
check
$ dpkg -s eclipse-pde

To install Subclipse:
 • Open Eclipse, go into the menus : Help -> Install New Software...
 • Click "Add..." and add a new Remote Site with URL: http://subclipse.tigris.org/update Name: subclipse.tigris.org
 • Select "Subclipse Plugin" and optionally "Subclipse Book"
 • Next, Next, Accept license terms, Finish.
 • Note: You do not need to select the other "integration" packages unless you have Mylyn or Mylar and plan on integrating with them. In fact, the integration packages can break things unless you have the packages they're intended to integrate with.
 • Restart Eclipse
1. Setup maven
   #sudo apt-get install maven2
2. Setup openjdk from ubuntu sofrware center
   search openjdk
3. copy all  folder + pom.xml file into advancedmapviewer project  folder
   4 Build 
   #cd path/to/your/project 
   #mvn clean install

=>create in .openstreetmap/osmosis/plugins fordel mapsforge-map-writer-0.3.0-SNAPSHOT.jar + mapsforge-POI-writer-0.3.0-SNAPSHOT.jar
and now, project can run, mapsforge-map-writer-0.3.0-SNAPSHOT.jar file is use to convert OpenStreetMap data into the .map format.

issues.title: Debbuging an application with a MapView leaks memory
issues.body:
_From [steffen....@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/102776401320875068115/) on February 16, 2012 14:31:44_

What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Start a Debug Session
2. Repeatedly open an activity with a MapView
3. You will get an OutOfMemoryException

This happens because when a process is debugged threads won't be collected by the GC. See https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=7979 Proposed solution:
Null all references at the end of life of all threads to prevent the memory leak.

**Attachment:** [Null_all_references_in_thread_to_prevent_a_memory_leak,_when_debugging.patch](http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=252)

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=252_

issues.title: AdvancedMapViewer on Honeycomb and beyond
issues.body:
_From [LudwigBr...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/113327232123772191739/) on February 14, 2012 11:01:12_

The patch provided here addressed two issues:

1) The AMV has a problem on Android devices running Honeycomb or ICS without a menu button as the NoTitleBar theme applied hides the action bar, so no access to the menu is possible. This is a bug as it makes a lot of the AMV functionality unavailable. The simple fix is to simply not apply a theme that hides the action bar. (A more complex solution would be to have different themes for versions <= 10 and >= 11.) 

2) The second issue addressed is better support for the ActionBar. The patch generally follows the advice given here http://android-developers.blogspot.com/2012/01/say-goodbye-to-menu-button.html The changes only affect the menu_options.xml file and are backwards compatible (I have tested with 2.2 but there should be no impact on 1.6 either, I just do not have the emulators for this installed anymore). My choice was to show the position, style and mapfile options if possible, while hiding settings, screenshot etc in the overflow.

I have attached a patch for both issues and a few screenshots how the AMV looks like on a NOVO7 Elf Tablet running Android 4.0.3.

**Attachment:** [AMV.diff device-2012-02-14-175039.png device-2012-02-14-175136.png device-2012-02-14-175058.png](http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=248)

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=248_

issues.title: Do not filter way points on high zoom levels
issues.body:
_From [thilo.mu...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/109067824594513388759/) on January 22, 2012 16:37:26_

The map-writer filters out way points by using the Douglas-Peucker algorithm. This can lead to bad geometries in particular when viewing the map on high zoom levels (> 16). The attached screenshot demonstrates an example, where the filtering of way points was done too aggressively. The original map can be seen here: http://www.openstreetmap.org/?lat=52.5144&lon=13.35019&zoom=17&layers=O

issues.title: 'current block size too large' error
issues.body:
_From [LudwigBr...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/113327232123772191739/) on January 16, 2012 05:28:50_

I was just testing the current svn version with a map of a part of Switzerland, particularly as a few of the lakes there were not rendered correctly in the old 0.24 version. 

Information in this area is quite dense and I got a couple of error messages at higher zoom levels like this:

W/MapDatabase(28283): current block size too large: 2129624

with the resulting area just white.

Changing the maximum block size in ReadBuffer.java to 

```
static final int MAXIMUM_BUFFER_SIZE = 3000000;
```

made the problem go away. I only quickly tested this on a Nexus S running 4.03 and on an emulator running 2.2 without ill-effects. 

Obviously there is a reason for limiting the buffer size, but not being able to display certain map areas is also undesirable. 

The good news is that, with the larger buffer, the lakes seem now all rendered correctly!

I am happy to supply the mapfile, but it is a bit too large to attach. The region in question was around Luzern (south of Zurich). I guess the problem will also occur in other high density areas.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=232_

issues.title: Merge outer ways of multi polygons
issues.body:
_From [jjbross@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/jjbross@gmail.com/) on October 16, 2011 19:05:04_

As discussed in issue148 , some OSM relations are not correctly processed when it comes to multi polygons:

It is possible to model a multi polygon from multiple outer ways, which considered separately are not closed polygons. Only a concatenation of these ways in the correct order forms a closed polygon. Currently we do not merge such ways to a closed polygon and just do not add them to the map.

The processing of relations that describe multi polygons must be improved to cover the mentioned case. The case does not only restrict to outer ways, but may potentially happen with inner ways also.

Building a closed polygon from multiple ways implicates that a completely new way (TDWay) needs to be created. This will be a way that actually is not existent in the raw data and thus raises the question which ID it should get (if any???). As there may be more than one multi polygon described by one relation, we cannot simply use the ID of the relation. Is the ID important? What other implications do we encounter, if we create new ways?

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=188_

issues.title: Rounding error leads to geometry errors leads to crash of writer (r1451)
issues.body:
_From [LudwigBr...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/113327232123772191739/) on October 16, 2011 12:12:57_

I know the code currently checked for the new mapsfile writer is not yet production ready, but it exhibits a problem that is likely to persist in the code.

I was running the r1451 code to produce a map for the Munich area. 

This crashed with the following error:

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Invalid number of points in LinearRing (found 2 - must be 0 or >= 4)
    at com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.LinearRing.validateConstruction(LinearRing.java:114)
    at com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.LinearRing.<init>(LinearRing.java:106)
    at com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.GeometryFactory.createLinearRing(GeometryFactory.java:341)
    at com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.GeometryFactory.createLinearRing(GeometryFactory.java:328)
    at org.mapsforge.preprocessing.map.osmosis.GeoUtils.toJTSGeometry(GeoUtils.java:82)
    at org.mapsforge.preprocessing.map.osmosis.GeoUtils.toJtsWayBlock(GeoUtils.java:574)
    at org.mapsforge.preprocessing.map.osmosis.GeoUtils.preprocessWay(GeoUtils.java:777)
    at org.mapsforge.preprocessing.map.osmosis.MapFileWriter.preprocessWayNodes(MapFileWriter.java:812)
    at org.mapsforge.preprocessing.map.osmosis.MapFileWriter.writeSubfile(MapFileWriter.java:564)

Putting a bit more debugging info this, I tracked this down to the following way:

  <node id='7984159' timestamp='2009-02-09T19:21:00Z' uid='51782' user='maxbe' visible='true' version='2' changeset='307908' lat='48.1798614' lon='11.7105929' />
  <node id='945277232' timestamp='2010-10-11T18:07:39Z' uid='344721' user='stumpi80' visible='true' version='1' changeset='6014139' lat='48.1798616' lon='11.7105927' />
  <way id='81112137' timestamp='2010-10-11T18:07:39Z' uid='344721' user='stumpi80' visible='true' version='1' changeset='6014139'>
    <nd ref='945277232' />
    <nd ref='7984159' />
    <tag k='cycleway' v='track' />
    <tag k='highway' v='primary' />
    <tag k='name' v='Ismaninger Straße' />
    <tag k='ref' v='B 471' />
  </way>

This way contains two nodes with distinct nodes at either end, so technically this part of a test for a linear ring should have not been reached.  

However, the rounding employed by the various routines in between makes the two nodes identical in coordinates as their difference is very small and only affects the lowest digits. However, those digits are 'cut off' when converting the floating point value in the OSM data to int in TDNode, resulting in the same double values when converting back to double for the JTS Coordinate.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=187_

issues.title: Integrate the coastline algorithm into the mapfile-writer
issues.body:
_From [thilo.mu...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/109067824594513388759/) on October 14, 2011 18:53:28_

We decided to move the generation of closed (water and land) polygons from the map library to the mapfile-writer. We should be able to use our existing Java implementation for that, which is currently located in the android.maps package.

As the coastline algorithm is no longer executed by the map renderer, many water areas and islands will be missing until we have fixed this.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=185_

issues.title: Using multiple (e.g. 6 - 12) Overlays results in OutOfMemoryException
issues.body:
_From [thijsrec...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/108084490611369736403/) on September 11, 2011 10:58:15_

What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Add 6 (or more, depending on device) overlays to MapView What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expected: no problems
Result: Application crashes with exception OutOfMemoryError on Overlay-Bitmap.createBitmap line 477 What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Version: Latest version from trunk
Device: HD2 Android 2.3.5 Please provide any additional information below. LogCat reports:
- dalvikvm-heap - 1536000-byte external allocation too large for this process
- GraphicsJNI - VM won't let us allocate 1536000 bytes

Possible cause:
Each overlay uses 2 bitmaps which have screen-size dimensions. 
For the HD2 this is 800*480 pixels. 
Each pixel is ARGB_8888, 4 bytes. 
So the total amount of memory for the bitmaps used per overlay 
= 2 [bitmaps per overlay] \* 800 [pixels] \* 480 [pixels] \* 4[bytes per pixel]
= 2 [bitmaps per overlay] \* 1536000 [bytes per bitmap]
= 2,92 [MByte per overlay].

Trying to use 6 overlays results in required memory
= 6 [overlays] \* 2,92 [MBytes per overlay] = 17,58 [MByte]

The VM heap size normally is (32MByte, 24MByte, 16MByte, 12MByte).
It seems VM heap size of the HD2 is minimal 16MByte, because of the following:
- Using 5 overlays results in 14,64 MBytes of memory < 16MB VM heap 
- Using 6 overlays results in 17,58 MBytes of memory > 16MB VM heap -> OutOfMemoryError.

The creation of the overlay - bitmaps is done in Overlay.java, final void changeSize().

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=174_

issues.title: MapThemes Crash
issues.body:
_From [LudwigBr...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/113327232123772191739/) on September 10, 2011 07:08:20_

I have been playing with the new map themes and I am aware that this is not finished code, but I wanted to report one crash I am getting.

My setup is that I am using the osmarender.xml theme as a external file theme (I just copied it to a file) together with the osmarender theme that is only slightly modified. The main change is that I have taken the rendering of buildings out as an experiment on how the new model can be used to speed rendering up for slower devices. 

I sometimes get this crash when I switch from the more complex theme (original osmarender) to the simplified theme. The change of themes happens in onResume() in the MapViewer class derived from MapActivity. My understanding is that the redrawing of the map is at this point already in progress and that the change of themes does not happen as atomically as required.

E/AndroidRuntime( 1990): FATAL EXCEPTION: CanvasRenderer
E/AndroidRuntime( 1990): java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: Invalid index 185, size is 185
E/AndroidRuntime( 1990):    at java.util.ArrayList.throwIndexOutOfBoundsException(ArrayList.java:257)
E/AndroidRuntime( 1990):    at java.util.ArrayList.get(ArrayList.java:311)
E/AndroidRuntime( 1990):    at org.mapsforge.android.maps.CanvasRenderer.drawWays(CanvasRenderer.java:139)
E/AndroidRuntime( 1990):    at org.mapsforge.android.maps.DatabaseMapGenerator.executeJob(DatabaseMapGenerator.java:527)
E/AndroidRuntime( 1990):    at org.mapsforge.android.maps.MapGenerator.run(MapGenerator.java:91)

I assume that this happens because of the lookup into the arraylist still uses an index of the older, more complex, theme. 

Otherwise so far no issues, the new model, while markedly slower, opens up a range of new possibilities.

Ludwig

issues.title: Order of calling of onTap on Overlays
issues.body:
_From [max.doer...@googlemail.com](https://code.google.com/u/109090695291731553880/) on August 24, 2011 16:20:14_

What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. add overlay to the mapview which overrides onTap and add an overlayItem
2. add second overlay to the mapview which also overrides onTap and add another overlayItem close to the one in the first overlay, so the to OverlayItems overlay each other What is the expected output? What do you see instead? The drawable of the OverlayItem in the second Overlay overlays the drawable of the OverlayItem in the first Overlay, which is expected. But if you you tap on a region where the drawables overlay each other, the onTap of the _first_ overlay (which is at the bottom) is called. I would expect the onTap of the overlay at the top would be called because it's the item you can see.

Same probably applies to onLongPress.

I attached a patch but I'm not sure if this for loop is okay.

issues.title: Please provide http access to map files instead or besides of ftp
issues.body:
_From [debiltel...@googlemail.com](https://code.google.com/u/114714164125172045630/) on August 13, 2011 14:37:58_

Many stock web browsers on Android do not support ftp. In additions, many users now lack knowledge about how to use anonymous ftp as well as passive connections. Thus, I notice many questions related to how to get your maps for c:geo (which is mapsforge-enabled).

It would be much easier if you could make all your maps available via http. It is an established infrastructure with much better operational optimizations, such as proxies and caching.

In addition, this would make in-app downloading and installing maps much easier.

issues.title: Block width and height of a subfile should be written in to header
issues.body:
_From [SakirS...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/105542850597277139642/) on July 14, 2011 20:16:28_

In the current implementation the width and height of a subfile 
is recalculated at the client side.
Due to different precision errors on
different platforms, it is possible to recalculate the wrong value. 

So a simple way to solve this is to write the width and height in to the subfile header.

The 5054th way has no way nodes. The MapDatabase class detects this error in the map file. But after detection this error it just stops to read the fallowing ways. In this case it misses about 5000 fallowing ways.

I was trying to recover from this error but it seems that it is not possible to read the remaining ways. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Such ways with no nodes should not be included in the map file.

_From [LudwigBr...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/113327232123772191739/) on July 10, 2011 11:38:09_

I can reproduce an NPE in MapView:onTouchEvent, this is one error report from Google:

java.lang.NullPointerException

at android.view.ViewRoot.doDie(ViewRoot.java:2693)

at android.app.ActivityThread.handleRelaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:4040)
at android.app.ActivityThread.access$2400(ActivityThread.java:135)
at android.app.ActivityThread$H.handleMessage(ActivityThread.java:2140)
at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:99)

at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method)

In the current version 1253, the problem comes at MapView:1156.

I can reproduce this by touching the screen while the map is being shown, keeping my finger on the screen and rotating the device. I think this generates the onTouchEvent while the MapView is being resumed.

A fix would be to have a null test and just returning when touchEventHandler is 0.

Ludwig

issues.title: Highway level is always 0 in resulting sql from RoutingGraphWriterTask -> Wrong travel costs calculation
issues.body:
_From [t.be...@web.de](https://code.google.com/u/116115259306014664713/) on June 30, 2011 12:38:44_

Mapsforge Version 0.2.3 from subversion

Theres an error in 
org.mapsforge.preprocessing.routingGraph.osmosis.RoutingGraphWriterTask.transformToEdgesAndWrite(..)
line 321. 
The highway-Level in the resulting .sql file is always 0, because of wrong key
in wayTypes_2_id.get(getTag(way, "highway"))

getTag(way, "highway") returns a tag, but for the map we need the value of the returning Tag.

Correction:
wayTypes_2_id.get(getTag(way, "highway").getValue())

osmosis --rb file=new_hampshire.osm.pbf --mapfile-writer file=NH.map type=HD

For some reason I cannot even create a very small slice out of the center, because L1=43.7, L2=43.8 fails.

04-23 13:38:48.643: INFO/DEBUG(31):     478cecf0  df002777  
04-23 13:38:48.643: INFO/DEBUG(31):     478cecf4  e3a070ad  
04-23 13:38:48.643: INFO/DEBUG(31): #00 478cecf8  478ced30  
04-23 13:38:48.643: INFO/DEBUG(31):     478cecfc  00000004  
04-23 13:38:48.643: INFO/DEBUG(31):     478ced00  42bd6c67  /data/dalvik-cache/system@framework@framework.jar@classes.dex
04-23 13:38:48.643: INFO/DEBUG(31):     478ced04  ad34b461  /system/lib/libandroid_runtime.so
04-23 13:38:48.653: INFO/DEBUG(31): #01 478ced08  478ced30  
04-23 13:38:48.653: INFO/DEBUG(31):     478ced0c  80813978  /system/lib/libdvm.so

I am including this output only for those who stumble over the same problem as it does actually give very little clue as to the bug that is causing the problem.

What actually causes the problem is a race condition in Overlay.java when resizing the canvas. 

When resizing the screen setupOverlay is being called which creates a new bitmaps and a new canvas. Since this method is not synchronized, it can happen (and somehow very regularly happened in my case) that redraw() is already being called right between the points where the bitmap as been set and the size of the bitmap is inquired. So, setupOverlay() creates a new canvas with no bitmap, so the call 
this.overlayCanvas.getWidth() fails with a null pointer, resulting in the obscure error from logcat.

When I started writing this, I thought I already had a working solution, but I have now found that it would cause its own synchronization problems. As I am right now running out of time today, I am just pushing this issue out, maybe someone else has an easy fix for this.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=116_

```
@Override
protected OverlayItem createItem(int i) {
    synchronized (this.overlayItems) {
        return this.overlayItems.get(i);
    }
}
```

which actually gives the OverlayItem back which is in the i'th position. Isn't it better to call this method getItem() or getItemFromIndex() or something like that???

Description copied from class: ItemizedOverlay

issues.title: Pass-through of map boundary for offline maps
issues.body:
_From [LudwigBr...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/113327232123772191739/) on March 06, 2011 16:40:37_

Currently there seems to be no way to determine the boundaries of an offline map for the higher-level MapViewer functions. However, this can be useful, e.g. when deciding if a user's current location is within the map boundary and it is possible to display his location on a map.

I have attached a patch that provides an getMapBoundary() in the MapView. It essentially passes through the map boundary from the lower levels, where this info is available. If an online map (which is generally boundless) is used, null is returned.

There is of course the problem that some maps do not really have a rectangular boundary, e.g. a polygon cut-out. However, this patch addresses already a lot of cases, is straight-forward and does not break anything.

**Attachment:** [mapboundary.patch](http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=91)

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=91_

issues.title: Polygon clipping in the mapfile-writer produces wrong results
issues.body:
_From [thilo.mu...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/109067824594513388759/) on December 23, 2010 20:30:45_

The mapfile-writer clipps polygons by default to reduce the size of the ouput file. Unfortunately there is a bug in the implementation which sometimes leads to bad results. As clipping is done with the help of the JTS library, it may also be caused by a problem in this external library.

I have attached two screenshots to demonstrate the problem. They both show the same tile at the same zoomlevel (at the west coast of iceland). You can see the tile rendered by Osmarender here: http://a.tah.openstreetmap.org/Tiles/tile/15/14349/8624.png The raw OSM data of the problematic way is here: http://www.openstreetmap.org/browse/way/7992579 Link to the slippy map with the centered tile: http://www.openstreetmap.org/?lat=64.54887&lon=-22.34551&zoom=15&layers=O For the second picture i recreated the iceland.map file, but this time with the "polygon-clipping=false" parameter. This increase the file size a little bit but fixes the problem completely.

I have also attached a text file with the pixel coordinates of the clipped way in the tile. It is visible that the clipped polygon consists of 9 nodes and that the lines between the 5th and the 6th node intersect with the previous lines. This must never happen, clipping polygons should result in simple polygons.

**Attachment:** [polygon_clipping_bug.png polygon_clipping_correct.png clipped_polygon_pixel_coordinates.txt](http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=62)

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=62_

issues.body:
_From [thilo.mu...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/109067824594513388759/) on December 20, 2010 16:44:34_

The current implementation of the MapFileWriter Osmosis plugin uses hardcoded enums for POI and way tags with their corresponding zoom level. This design makes it impossible to modify these numeric values or add new tags without recompiling and recreating a new jar file. That contradicts our mission goal to build flexible and customizable tools.

Therefore the implementation should be changed so that the values are read from plain text files at startup. These files have to follow a certain syntax as we are already using in the tag_list_pois.txt and tag_list_ways.txt files. I propose two additional parameters like "tag-list-nodes" and "tag-list-ways" which can be used to specify the path to these text files.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=59_

issues.title: Mapfile writer osmosis plugin does not work properly on Windows platform
issues.body:
_From [jjbross@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/jjbross@gmail.com/) on November 21, 2010 18:16:05_

The plugin uses memory mapped IO due to performance reasons. According to the Java specification, there is no guarantee when the resources held by MappedByteBuffers are freed. Resources are released when a buffer gets garbage collected. This fact leads to problems on the Windows platform when truncating the file to its actual size.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=41_

issues.title: Improve ImageFileCache
issues.body:
_From [diewurst...@googlemail.com](https://code.google.com/u/108365981776099635882/) on October 04, 2010 22:44:52_

At the moment tiles from different MapGenerators are saved to the same files on hard disk based on cacheId aka index in queue? I think that's not right and should be changed. For every MagGenerator different directory.

Tiles should be saved in a format like "z/x/y.tile" and not based on cacheId (index in cache or priority queue).

ImageFileCache() doesn't check for existing tiles on creation. Perhaps format shouldn't be "z/x/y.tile" so we don't have to traverse all directories?

I can patch this if you want...
