_From [thilo.mu...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/109067824594513388759/) on July 17, 2010 09:59:17_

Currently the rendering quality of labels and texts in the map is very different. On some Android devices it looks almost perfect (for instance on the Samsung Galaxy), while on other devices texts are hardly readable (for example on the Xperia X10). If possible, this should be fixed so that texts look fine on all screens and devices.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=29_

issues.title: Write Javadoc for all public/protected classes, methods and fields
issues.body:
_From [thilo.mu...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/109067824594513388759/) on July 03, 2010 12:15:44_

We have too many undocumented classes and methods with public or protected visibility in our trunk. This is really bad, nobody will ever understand and use this code unless it is fully documented.

Eclipse can be configured to trigger a warning for every missing Javadoc comment. When activated, it reports more than 1.000 additional warnings, which means we have more than 1.000 missing Javadoc comments on public or protected classes/methods/fields!

I don't know if we should enable this check so that everybody sees the warnings and starts working on them. Documenting code is not optional but absolutely fundamential and one important convention of our project. Probably many of these classes and methods don't need to be public, so their visibility should be reduced, which would reduce the problem.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=27_

issues.title: Fix warnings in Highway Hierarchies source code
issues.body:
_From [thilo.mu...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/109067824594513388759/) on June 22, 2010 08:55:11_

Currently there are more than 55 (!) warnings in source files related to the HH routing algorithm. Most of these warnings exist already for a longer time. Some of them are simple Javadoc errors, that could easily be fixed. 

Please resolve all these problems in a reasonable way. They give a bad impression of the project and the quality of the HH implementation. Important warnings are very likely to be overseen among the flood of minor, uncritical warnings.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=25_

issues.title: Compile Error in org.mapsforge.android.map.OpenGlMapGenerator
Each MapView needs its own cache folder on the SD card
issues.body:
_From [thilo.mu...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/109067824594513388759/) on June 01, 2010 13:10:59_

Currently the SD card cache puts all cached images into one default
directory, no matter which MapView created them. As different MapViews may
have different image sources and rendering settings, these cached images
must not be shared among several MapViews.

Another problem is that already existing images may be overwritten by
another instance of the SD card cache, as there is no check for already
existing files. The cache assumes that no other cache is writing images in
the cache directory and therefore a file with the same name cannot exist.
With more than one MapView running concurrently this assumption is wrong.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=22_

issues.title: OutOfMemoryException when index for map file to large
issues.body:
_From [jjbross@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/jjbross@gmail.com/) on May 28, 2010 14:14:38_

The index to blocks in a map file is currently hold completely in main
memory. If the map file is too large, the Android client will throw an
OutOfMemoryException as the index does not fit into RAM. We need have the
index on disk and provide a small cache.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=14_

issues.title: Avoid collisions of POI names and area labels
issues.body:
_From [thilo.mu...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/109067824594513388759/) on May 25, 2010 17:05:14_

Currently the map renderer doesn't check for collisions when placing
labels. This can lead to very ugly results (see screenshot) when too many
labels are placed and massive overlapping occurs. It happens especially on
high zoom levels, as most of the names and labels are only visible at a
higher zoom level.

**Attachment:** [screenshot_label_collisions.png](http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=3)

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=3_

issues.title: Large areas have incomplete background color
issues.body:
_From [thilo.mu...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/109067824594513388759/) on May 25, 2010 14:23:46_

If a large area surrounds a map tile without intersecting it, the area will
not be assigned to this inner map tile and thus the inner map tile will be
rendered with the default white background only.

This bug exists only due to the way our old map converter works and is not
really a rendering issue.

**Attachment:** [screenshot_large_areas_bug.png](http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=2)

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=2_

issues.title: Water area covers land surface
issues.body:
_From [thilo.mu...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/109067824594513388759/) on May 25, 2010 14:17:20_

Move the map to a region with coastlines and water areas. The blue water
sometimes covers the land, also white areas appear where blue water should be.

The reason for this is the currently implemented algorithm for calculating
closed water polygons. It is known to give bad results under certain
circumstances and needs to be replaced with a better one.

**Attachment:** [screenshot_coastline_bug1.png screenshot_coastline_bug2.png](http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=1)

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/issues/detail?id=1_
